intro: Jamesbrittenia acutiloba, commonly known as the sharp-lobed jamesbrittenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters in its natural habitat. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
